task_1755394261203_i4kwx8p5i.title: Revise Bottom_Jig_2_1 CAD for Critical Tolerance Issue
task_1755394261203_i4kwx8p5i.description: A critical tolerance stack-up issue has been identified in the Bottom_Jig_2_1 CAD's mounting features, preventing proper mechanical interface with the PotentiostatV5_2 PCB. This task requires a complete re-evaluation and revision of the Bottom_Jig_2_1 design, including re-iteration on the CAD and confirming manufacturing feasibility for the revised specifications. This is critical to avoid delays in the initial physical prototyping phase.

task_1755394299071_90a3cldet.title: Achieve consistent NAT Card 3D Prints
task_1755394299071_90a3cldet.description: Address persistent warping and undefined features when 3D printing the NAT card using MED412 resin on the Phrozen printer, despite extensive support and orientation adjustments. This issue is directly impacting cytotoxicity validation.

task_1755394299071_gskhyx3lh.title: Resolve Cytometry Card Fluidic Issues
task_1755394299071_gskhyx3lh.description: Address unpredictable flow rates and capillary filaments blocking air holes in the cytometry cards, which are hindering consistent fluidic testing and video capture.

task_1755394299071_mu8x7wgez.title: Execute Iterative Design & Print Trials
task_1755394299071_mu8x7wgez.description: Perform additional iterative design and print trials as necessitated by the persistent 3D printing issues with NAT cards and fluidic challenges with cytometry cards. This action is critical to overcome current technical blockers and mitigate project timeline delays.

task_1755394331895_t1g4nxrlf.title: Integrate Angular Spectrum Method in SampleGenerator
task_1755394331895_t1g4nxrlf.description: Finalized the integration of the angular spectrum method for LED simulation and light propagation within the `SampleGenerator` file.

task_1755394331895_qujp5chxt.title: Develop NN architectures for phase/amplitude reconstruction
task_1755394331895_qujp5chxt.description: Initiated development on neural network architectures for phase and amplitude reconstruction, leveraging insights gained during the SaPR implementation for initial model design considerations.

task_1755394345037_mmzxrmok4.title: Refine SampleGenerator for LED simulations with angular spectrum method
task_1755394345037_mmzxrmok4.description: Continued refining the `SampleGenerator` file, integrating the angular spectrum method for more accurate LED light propagation simulations. This update is critical for generating robust training data for subsequent phase and amplitude reconstruction efforts.

update_1755394241020_33sqpn0o8.messageText: Advanced the high-sensitivity APD board bring-up for fluorescence detection, actively troubleshooting photon detection complexity by optimizing op-amp gains and addressing noise sources. Concurrently, we've finalized the Top Board pogo pin redesign and continued iterating on brushless motor driver selection, focusing on seamless integration with the 3.0 Jig and Megastat systems.

update_1755394261264_galrmvwmp.messageText: During the detailed review of the PotentiostatV5_2 and Bottom_Jig_2_1 CAD files, I've identified a critical tolerance stack-up issue in the jig's mounting features that would prevent proper mechanical interface with the potentiostat's PCB. This requires a complete re-evaluation and revision of the Bottom_Jig_2_1 design, potentially delaying the initial physical prototyping phase by 2-3 days while I re-iterate on the CAD and confirm manufacturing feasibility for the revised specifications.

extractedTasks.title: Revise Bottom_Jig_2_1 CAD for Critical Tolerance Issue
extractedTasks.description: A critical tolerance stack-up issue has been identified in the Bottom_Jig_2_1 CAD's mounting features, preventing proper mechanical interface with the PotentiostatV5_2 PCB. This task requires a complete re-evaluation and revision of the Bottom_Jig_2_1 design, including re-iteration on the CAD and confirming manufacturing feasibility for the revised specifications. This is critical to avoid delays in the initial physical prototyping phase.

update_1755394302849_wmn7nqhzu.messageText: I am facing persistent challenges 3D printing the NAT card with MED412 on the Phrozen, where warping and undefined features continue despite extensive support and orientation adjustments, directly impacting cytotoxicity validation. Additionally, unpredictable flow rates and capillary filaments blocking air holes in the cytometry cards are hindering consistent fluidic testing and video capture. This necessitates more iterative design and print trials, which is causing delays in both project timelines.

extractedTasks.title: Achieve consistent NAT Card 3D Prints
extractedTasks.description: Address persistent warping and undefined features when 3D printing the NAT card using MED412 resin on the Phrozen printer, despite extensive support and orientation adjustments. This issue is directly impacting cytotoxicity validation.

extractedTasks.title: Resolve Cytometry Card Fluidic Issues
extractedTasks.description: Address unpredictable flow rates and capillary filaments blocking air holes in the cytometry cards, which are hindering consistent fluidic testing and video capture.

extractedTasks.title: Execute Iterative Design & Print Trials
extractedTasks.description: Perform additional iterative design and print trials as necessitated by the persistent 3D printing issues with NAT cards and fluidic challenges with cytometry cards. This action is critical to overcome current technical blockers and mitigate project timeline delays.

Simultaneously, initiated development on neural network architectures for phase and amplitude reconstruction, leveraging insights gained during the SaPR implementation for initial model design considerations.

update_1755394378772_ckpnnqk4z.messageText: RT-LAMP workflow validation is ongoing; initial runs, while improvising with Syber Green Master Mix and Triton X-100 due to material constraints, helped identify critical PCR software glitches and equipment heating issues that require immediate troubleshooting. Concurrently, significant progress has been made on lab setup, though I'm still actively organizing the comprehensive inventory and ensuring all biosafety compliance measures are fully established.

update_1755394467470_dqvl6pi7l.messageText: Successfully brought three 3.0 Jig systems to operational status by resolving a critical hardware bug, and completed the LabSImple Megastat PID heater board bringup. Significant progress was also made on the high-sensitivity optical setup for APD board fluorescence detection, with an updated top board order placed to resolve pogo pin issues, furthering our system integration.
